jzebra
Class JZebra

java.lang.Object
  jzebra.JZebra

public class JZebra
extends java.lang.Object

Takes string commands intended for Zebra or Eltron type printers and sends them directly to the printer in RAW mode.

Using in your application is as easy as: 

  PrinterService ps = JZebra.getBestPrinter("Eltron");
  Zebra.print(ps, "A\r");

Author:
A. Tres Finocchiaro

print

public static boolean print(javax.print.PrintService ps,
                            java.lang.String commands)
                     throws javax.print.PrintException
The meat and potatoes that actually generates the printjob that gets sent to the printer.

If you view the source, you'll notice this method is very simple. Fortunately, RAW printing is pretty simple to code, so view the source if you'd like to impliment directly.

Parameters:
ps - The PrintService object
commands - The RAW commands to be sent directly to the printer
Returns:
True if print job created successfull
Throws:
javax.print.PrintException

replaceCommands

public static java.lang.String replaceCommands(java.lang.String commands,
                                               java.lang.String[] replacements)
Does command replacement for the printer RAW commands in the format "1=COMMAND".

For example, the RAW commands to be sent to the printer may be something like follows: R\r&CDEW 0 0\r. The line breaks, or in this case carriage returns would be new lines in the config file. If we skip the comments, each command is a new line.

The command 2=&CDEW 1 1 will change the second command. This is usefull for keeping config files when changing only a few values, such as name or account number.

Parameters:
commands - The RAW printer commands
replacements - The array of replacement commands
Returns:

getBestPrinter

public static javax.print.PrintService getBestPrinter(java.lang.Object o)
Gets the best "PrintService" based on the given printer name "o" which should be of type String.

If not, it will do o.toString() and continue.

Given name does not need to be case sensitive, and can be any part of the printer name. For example: "eltron" can return "Eltron P310 Card Printer" etc.

Parameters:
o -
Returns:

processArgs

public static void processArgs(java.lang.String[] args)
Processes command line arguments.

If "--help", "-h", or "/?" was specified, prints help information and exits.

For more information on what arguments are available try the following in a command window: 

  java -jar JZebra.jar --help

Parameters:
args - The args passes from the main method.
